subject: Learning
title: Scaffolding: Guided Support
description: Learn Scaffolding: Guided Support in one minute.

hook.text: A teacher doesn't solve the problem for the student. She asks: 'What have you tried? What could you try next?'

buildup.text: Scaffolding is temporary support that helps a learner accomplish a task they couldn't do independently.

discovery.text: Effective scaffolding breaks complex tasks into steps, models the process, and asks guiding questions.

twist.text: The key is gradual release: the scaffold must be removed over time, or the child becomes dependent.

climax.text: Well-timed scaffolding turns 'I can't' into 'I can'â€”and eventually into 'I can do it alone.'

punchline.text: Support just enough to succeed, then step back. Independence is the goal.

quiz.question: What is the critical feature of effective scaffolding?
options: Support must be gradually removed as the learner gains competence
Scaffolding should remain permanent for all learners
